title: Clients Vote Citi Best Regional Cash Management Bank in Latin America in Euromoney's 2011 Annual Cash Management Survey
summary: Miami, Florida – Citi today announced that its Treasury and Trade Solutions business was voted the #1 Best Regional Cash Management Bank in Latin America for the fifth consecutive year in Euromoney's 2011 Cash Management Survey, by non-financial institutions. The bank has also been top ranked by non-financial institutions as the Best Domestic Cash Management Bank in Argentina and Mexico (Banamex), and is within the top three positions in Colombia; as well as Best USD Bank in Latin America by financial institutions.
tag-1: Clients Vote Citi Best Regional Cash Management Bank in Latin America in Euromoney's 2011 Annual Cash Management Survey
tag-3: Miami, Florida – Citi today announced that its Treasury and Trade Solutions business was voted the #1 Best Regional Cash Management Bank in Latin America for the fifth consecutive year in Euromoney's 2011 Cash Management Survey, by non-financial institutions. The bank has also been top ranked by non-financial institutions as the Best Domestic Cash Management Bank in Argentina and Mexico (Banamex), and is within the top three positions in Colombia; as well as Best USD Bank in Latin America by financial institutions.
tag-4: "Citi's continued recognition by our clients in these prestigious surveys, both at a regional and country level, distinguishes our sustained efforts to deliver the best service solutions. We are very proud of the recognitions received and are committed to investing in innovation and leading Cash Management products and services in Latin America and Mexico," said Francisco Aristeguieta, Global Transaction Services, Latin America and Mexico Region Head. "The Euromoney survey provides our clients an opportunity to tell us how we're delivering against this promise of being strategically relevant to their business priorities and operating models, and we'd like to thank them for once again voting Citi number one."
tag-5: Euromoney has been conducting the Cash Management Poll since 2001 and is considered to be one of the most respected surveys in the financial services industry.
tag-6: The Euromoney Cash Management Survey 2011 uses a methodology that involves polling cash managers, treasurers and financial officers worldwide. The survey is split into a non-financial institutions questionnaire and a financial institutions questionnaire. Respondents are asked to indicate which three banks they currently use most for their cash management services.
tag-8: Global Transaction Services, a division of Citi's Institutional Clients Group, offers integrated cash management, trade, and securities and fund services to multinational corporations, financial institutions and public sector organizations around the world. With a network that spans more than 100 countries, Citigroup's Global Transaction Services supports over 65,000 clients. As of the second quarter of 2011, it held on average $365 billion in liability balances and $13.5 trillion in assets under custody.
tag-10: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
